newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: KLM adds destinations to winter timetable.
newsitem.headline: KLM adds destinations to winter timetable.

text.p: KLM is launching three new destinations from Amsterdam's Schipol on October 27, a KLM spokesman said.
San Juan in Puerto Rico, the Azerbeijan capital of Baku, and Bologna in Italy will be added to KLM's winter schedule.
The moves are largely driven by tourist demand, but there will be considerable cargo capacity available, he said.
San Juan will be operated twice-weekly with a McDonnell Douglas MD-11, via St.Martin in the Caribbean. The aircraft has a capacity of around ten to 15 tons, depending on its passenger lift.
Cargo expected on the route includes pharmaceuticals, chemicals, footwear and electronics, said the spokesman, speaking from KLM's Netherlands headquarters.
A Boeing 767, will be deployed on the Baku route and this destination will be operated three times a week.
This destination has been added because of the oil, gas and mineral industry in the area.
Spare parts and mining equipment for explorations in the area are likely to be the major cargo consignments.
Bologna, will be KLM's fifth destination in Italy and it will be operated twice-daily with a Fokker 70.
As well as this, the Dutch carrier will increase its Atlanta flights from four to five per week from January 1997 and Taipei will be increased by one flight to six a week, a company statement said.
Accra also gets an additional frequency from December 3, bringing the service up to four times a week. - Air Cargo Newsroom Tel+44 171 542 7706 Fax+44 171 542 5027
